# of Math Courseware Available.rationale: Tracks development and deployment of TPP-aligned gateway math courseware. By Fall 2028, Learnvia aims to publish at least five new courseware products. This demonstrates platform maturity and content coverage essential for scaling impact.
# of Math Courseware Available.target_rationale: With strong technical and operational talent, CMU's expertise in STEM education and AI, and the foundation's track record, delivering five high-quality courseware by 2030 is ambitious but achievable. Early Calculus 1 launch demonstrates execution capability.
# of Math Courseware Available.data_availability: Counted from Learnvia platform releases. Updated quarterly as new courseware launches.

# of Student Users Served per AY.rationale: Measures platform adoption and annual reach. By 2030, Learnvia aims to reach 180,000 students annually (about 6% of 2.7M U.S. gateway math enrollments), establishing a credible foothold for large-scale growth.
# of Student Users Served per AY.target_rationale: Incumbents like Pearson MyLab and McGraw Hill ALEKS already serve hundreds of thousands of students, proving market demand. Learnvia enters well-capitalized with differentiated advantages: AI-enabled, evidence-based, free to students.
# of Student Users Served per AY.data_availability: Real-time tracking from Learnvia platform. Disaggregated by post-secondary vs. high school (DE/DC), and by race/ethnicity and Pell status where available.

Course Success Rate - Calculus I.rationale: Gateway math courses are primary barriers to degree completion, especially for first-generation and underrepresented students. Improving course success rates directly impacts persistence and completion.
Course Success Rate - Calculus I.target_rationale: Target: 80% pass rate OR +10 percentage points (whichever requires smaller lift). Targets account for focus institutions typically starting 5-10pp below baseline rates. By 2030, this translates to 144K students/year who pass because of Learnvia courseware.
Course Success Rate - Calculus I.data_availability: Reported per term (Fall/Spring) from institution records. Disaggregated by race/ethnicity and Pell status.

Equity Gap - Calculus.rationale: Closing equity gaps is central to the foundation's mission. Reducing gaps by 50% by 2030 demonstrates meaningful progress toward equitable outcomes for underrepresented students.
Equity Gap - Calculus.target_rationale: 50% reduction from baseline (13.4% â†’ 6.7%) represents ambitious but achievable goal. Focus on institutions serving high populations of focus students maximizes equity impact.
Equity Gap - Calculus.data_availability: Calculated from course success rate data disaggregated by race/ethnicity. Reported per term from institution records.

Cost per Course Development.rationale: Tracking development costs enables efficiency improvements and sustainability planning. Current estimates: $2-3M per course. AI advances may reduce costs by 2030.
Cost per Course Development.target_rationale: AI-enabled development tools can streamline courseware creation, reducing costs from $2.5M to $2M by 2030 and $1.5M by 2045 while maintaining quality.
Cost per Course Development.data_availability: From finance records. Updated when new courseware completes development phase.

Efficacy Research Studies Count.rationale: Evidence base demonstrating causal impact strengthens platform credibility and guides continuous improvement. RCT and quasi-experimental studies provide validation of courseware effectiveness.
Efficacy Research Studies Count.target_rationale: Growing evidence base (from 2 to 4+ studies by 2030) demonstrates statistically significant improvements in learning outcomes and supports scaling decisions.
Efficacy Research Studies Count.data_availability: Tracked from research database. Updated upon publication of peer-reviewed studies.
